sentences.english: The ship's orchestra's conductor stood to one side, looking peeved but apprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 艦隊的管弦樂團指揮站在一邊，面色雖慍怒但很知趣。

sentences.english: He remained impervious to all nell's sulks and blandishments.
sentences.chinese: 對尼爾的慍怒和甜言蜜語，他都無動於衷。

sentences.english: In a lot of Aboriginal communities there's an air of sullen hostility.
sentences.chinese: 很多土著社區裏的人都有一種慍怒的敵對情緒。

sentences.english: He is liable to sudden changes of mood and would sulk and cry for no apparent reason.
sentences.chinese: 他的情緒容易突變，且會無緣無故地慍怒和哭泣。

sentences.english: But this time he was being greeted by sullen indifference.
sentences.chinese: 但是這次慍怒的歐洲人對他卻是不理不睬。

sentences.english: She brought along a couple of sulky looking kids.
sentences.chinese: 她帶來幾個臉色慍怒的孩子。

sentences.english: She had not come to him today with this feeling of sullen antagonism.
sentences.chinese: 她今天並沒有帶着這種慍怒的牴觸情緒到他這兒來。

sentences.english: Freddie stared sullenly at his younger brother.
sentences.chinese: 弗烈特繃着臉慍怒地瞪着他弟弟。

sentences.english: Used to express surprise, wonder, triumph, puzzlement , or pique.
sentences.chinese: 用來表示驚訝，驚奇，欣喜若狂，迷惑或慍怒。

definition: to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
lit. the trees long for peace but the wind will never cease (idiom)/fig. the world changes, whether you want it or not
pinyin: shu4 yu4 jing4 er2 feng1 bu4 zhi3
